oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Genetically Engineered Products: Federal Evaluation Responsibilities
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Harvey, Terence
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: animal health care products
FDA
EPA
therapeutic agents
genetically engineered products
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Historically, animal health care products have basically been under the jurisdiction of the Food and Drug Administration, the U.S. Department of Agriculture, and more recently the Environmental Protection Agency. Agents intended for therapeusis can be broadly categorized into three types: Drugs, biologicals, and pesticides for use external to the mucosal barrier. The advent of the emerging and, quite frankly, exciting technology relating to genetically engineered products which we have heard interesting things about this morning proceeded outside the legalistic framework described previously. I, and I am sure you, agree that if scientific truth and productivity had to contend with things other than the laws of nature we would all be less advantaged
